snippet: The drug, canagliflozin, is being developed by Johnson & Johnson and is part of a group of drugs that lowers blood sugar by causing the sugar to be excreted through urine.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration advisory panel votes 10 to 5 to approve diabetes drug canagliflozin, which could be the first in a new class of drugs in the United States to treat the disease; some members raise concerns about several risks associated with drug, made by Johnson & Johnson.
lead_paragraph: The drug, canagliflozin, is being developed by Johnson & Johnson and is part of a group of drugs that lowers blood sugar by causing the sugar to be excreted through urine.

headline.seo: F.D.A. Advisory Panel Votes to Approve Diabetes Drug
headline.main: F.D.A. Advisory Panel Votes to Approve Diabetes Drug
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Advisory Panel Votes to Approve Diabetes Drug
